Posts.Content: Hi Kiki, I'm so sorry to hear about that terrible ordeal you went through. What I went through, with the robot, was surgery for prostate cancer. I noticed that your ordeal was after having a liver biopsy, so I wonder if you'd like me to transfer your post to the liver cancer forum? They may have more information and experience with the after effects of a liver biopsy. So, please let me know and I can transfer your post over to them where they may be able to offer you better advice. In any case, we're glad to be here even as a sounding board because sometimes we just need to scream to someone. Good luck with the biopsy results, Chuck
Posts.Signature: July 2011 local PSA lab reading 6.41 (from 4.1 in 2009). Mayo Clinic PSA 9/ 2011 = 5.7. Local uro DRE revealed significant BPH, no lumps. PCa Dx Aug. 2011 age of 61. Biopsy DXd adenocarcinoma in 3/20 cores (one 5%, two 20%). T2C. Gleason 3+3=6. CT abdomen, bone scan negative. DaVinci prostatectomy 11/1/11 at Mayo Clinic (Rochester, MN), nerve sparing, age 62. Surgeon was Dr. Matthew Tollefson, who I highly recommend. Final pathology shows tumor confined to prostate. 5 lymph nodes, seminal vesicules, extraprostatic soft tissue all negative. 1.0 x 0.6 x 0.6 cm mass involving right posterior inferior, right posterior apex & left mid posterior prostate. Right posterior apex margin involved by tumor over 0.2 cm length, doctor says this is insignificant. Prostate 98 grams, tumor 2 grams. Catheter out in 7 days. No incontinence, minor dripping for a few weeks. Seven annual post-op exams 2012 through 2018: PSA <0.1 Semi-firm erections without "training wheels," usable erections with 100mg Sildenafil. NOTE: ED caused by BPH, not the surgery.
Posts.Title: Liver Biopsy after Breast Cancer Surgery

Posts.Content: Hi there, I'll transfer your posts over to the breast cancer forum. They should be able to relate to your questions and give you some good answers and insight on this. The associated thread will be entitled, "Liver Biopsy after Breast Cancer Surgery." Wishing you the best! Chuck
